text.1_Chapter, 20_Verse, 0_Comment: TO WIPE OUT: To drive out
text.1_Chapter, 21_Verse, 0_Comment: TO TEST: from the language of test
text.2_Chapter, 14_Verse, 0_Comment: A matter of contraction as in Psalm 69: 16 "Don't let the mouth of the Pit not close over me." It is to say it is as if his right hand was contracted because he didn't extend it.
text.2_Chapter, 15_Verse, 0_Comment: MOUTHS: The sharp side of the sword is called the mouth
text.2_Chapter, 15_Verse, 1_Comment: GOMED: It is a cubit and in Ezekiel 27: 11 "And men of Gammad were stationed in your towers" its to say that these men were short people.
text.2_Chapter, 15_Verse, 2_Comment: His clothing as in Leviticus 6:3 "linen raiment."
text.2_Chapter, 15_Verse, 3_Comment: ...THIGH: His side as in Leviticus 1:11 "The side of the Altar."
text.2_Chapter, 16_Verse, 0_Comment: STOUT: a big fat guy, as in Kings 1:5:3 "Ten stout cows."
text.2_Chapter, 18_Verse, 0_Comment: Idols: the place where they carve out the face of the stone as in "the sons of Shlomo carved."
text.2_Chapter, 18_Verse, 1_Comment: Silence: a matter of quiet as in Numbers 13:30 "Calev was silent."
text.2_Chapter, 19_Verse, 0_Comment: From the language of upper, the upper construction
text.2_Chapter, 19_Verse, 1_Comment: From the language of cold and freezing
text.2_Chapter, 20_Verse, 0_Comment: And it got stuck: Thrust and insertion. As in Samuel 2:18:14 "and it was thrusted in the heart of Abshalom."
text.2_Chapter, 21_Verse, 0_Comment: The handle: this is the handle of the sword that it is based on to do its job
text.2_Chapter, 21_Verse, 1_Comment: the blade: this is the sword because it was shiny like a flame when its unsheathed as in Nachum 3:3 "the flashing sword."
text.2_Chapter, 21_Verse, 2_Comment: Drawn: taking it out. as in Joshua 5:13 "his drawn sword."
text.2_Chapter, 21_Verse, 3_Comment: The waste: The dung and the excrement.
text.2_Chapter, 22_Verse, 0_Comment: This is the portico that is arranged with chairs for people to sit in
text.2_Chapter, 22_Verse, 1_Comment: next to him as in Genesis 7:16 "Hashem closed it next to him."
text.2_Chapter, 22_Verse, 2_Comment: It wants to teach that it was also closed form the lock
text.2_Chapter, 23_Verse, 0_Comment: It is a euphemism for reliving himself as an Samuel 1:24:3 "And Saul came to relive himself." Its named this based on the way that he is sitting down and facing. To shut in and to cover his legs because of modesty.
text.2_Chapter, 24_Verse, 0_Comment: They waited as in Genesis 8:10 "He waited longer"
text.2_Chapter, 24_Verse, 1_Comment: Lateness : as in Kings 2:8:11 "And he kept it for a long time."
text.2_Chapter, 24_Verse, 2_Comment: The name of the tool that opens something that's locked.
text.2_Chapter, 25_Verse, 1_Comment: Matter of waiting. As in Genesis 43:10. "If only we had not waited"
text.2_Chapter, 30_Verse, 0_Comment: Ox Goad: this is the stick that at the top of it has the eye of a needle stuck in it and its called a spur. With it you teach and scare the cattle to plow
text.3_Chapter, 5_Verse, 0_Comment: KEDESH NAFTALI: its the name of the place in the inheritance of Naftali
text.3_Chapter, 6_Verse, 0_Comment: His army: its a matter of a huge nation. considering they killed a lot
text.3_Chapter, 9_Verse, 0_Comment: they answered the meeting that was gathered by the call of the gatherer, as in 18:23 "what do you want, why did you shout.?"
text.3_Chapter, 17_Verse, 1_Comment: This is a thick covering that was brought from it tassels. This Targum Yonatan as Genucha. this is also in Kings 2: 8:15. "and he took the netted piece of cloth" and Targum Yonatan translates it has Genucha.
text.3_Chapter, 18_Verse, 1_Comment: the name of the vessel that holds stuff
text.3_Chapter, 19_Verse, 0_Comment: from the language of asking something
text.3_Chapter, 20_Verse, 1_Comment: the name of the utensil, and with it you hit the peg into the ground. and in Yeshiyahu 44: 12 "And fashions it by hammering."
text.3_Chapter, 20_Verse, 2_Comment: With secrecy and stealth, as in Ruth 3:7 "she came secrecy and she revealed her legs."
text.3_Chapter, 20_Verse, 3_Comment: she embedded it and hid it
text.3_Chapter, 20_Verse, 4_Comment: this the side of the height of the face, as in Song of Songs 4:3 "Your brow behind your veil [Gleams] like a pomegranate split open." and its called this because of the lack of flesh on it as in Bresheit 41:19 "emaciated."
text.3_Chapter, 20_Verse, 5_Comment: its a matter of thrusting/inserting. as in Judges 1:14 she implanted [her feet] from off the donkey
text.3_Chapter, 20_Verse, 6_Comment: from the language of deep sleep
text.4_Chapter, 1_Verse, 0_Comment: A matter of Vengeance as in Numbers 31:2 "you shall surely take revenge. and according to the Targum
text.4_Chapter, 2_Verse, 1_Comment: A matter of dominion as in Tehelim 2:2 "and the princes gather together
text.4_Chapter, 3_Verse, 0_Comment: from the language of marching and walking
text.4_Chapter, 3_Verse, 1_Comment: from the language of dripping and pouring
text.4_Chapter, 4_Verse, 0_Comment: a matter of dripping as in Bamidbar 24: 7: "Water drips from its roots."
text.4_Chapter, 5_Verse, 2_Comment: from the language of twisted and bent
text.4_Chapter, 6_Verse, 0_Comment: these are unwalled cities, without a wall around them
text.4_Chapter, 7_Verse, 1_Comment: cities, as in Deuteronomy 17:2 "in one of your cities."
text.4_Chapter, 8_Verse, 0_Comment: The great ones are called law givers because they put down the law
text.4_Chapter, 9_Verse, 3_Comment: speak as in diveri hayamin 1:16:9 speak about all of His miracles.
text.4_Chapter, 10_Verse, 1_Comment: from the language of drawing water
text.4_Chapter, 10_Verse, 2_Comment: speaking as in devarim 6:7 "you shall teach it to your children." and Targum translates it as "you shall speak it." as well as later in judges 11:40 "speaking in the house of Yiftach."
text.4_Chapter, 11_Verse, 0_Comment: from the language of arousing and waking up
text.4_Chapter, 12_Verse, 0_Comment: Meaning dominion as in Tehelim 110:2 "rule over your enemies."
text.4_Chapter, 12_Verse, 1_Comment: Residue as in Jeremia 42: 17 "Remainder and refugee
text.4_Chapter, 12_Verse, 2_Comment: as in the mighty ones. the Lamed is in the place of the Bet so too in Leviticus 27: 7 "they fell by the sword in-front of them. In the sentence its With the sword
text.4_Chapter, 13_Verse, 2_Comment: Writing is the action of pulling the quill
text.4_Chapter, 14_Verse, 1_Comment: They went with him on foot. And earlier in 4:1 they went up on foot
text.4_Chapter, 14_Verse, 2_Comment: A matter of division as in Genesis 10:25 "the earth was divided."
text.4_Chapter, 14_Verse, 3_Comment: from the language of legislation. And we answered a thought
text.4_Chapter, 15_Verse, 0_Comment: From the word of language, and its a matter of border. just as the Targum: "border." this is also the translation of border in 49:14 "creeping between the sheepfolds."
text.4_Chapter, 15_Verse, 1_Comment: The sounds that comes when you press your lips together. As in Isaiah 5:26 "He will whistle to him" and he is asking about the flocks of sheep.
text.4_Chapter, 16_Verse, 0_Comment: To be gathered in as in Tehelim 59:4 "fierce men plot against me."
text.4_Chapter, 16_Verse, 2_Comment: The bank of the sea as in Deuteronomy 1:7 "on the bank of the sea."
